Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup with slightly concave lip profile; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim; below, lotus flower with faded added red or added white centre and red bottom, part of a chain of alternating and opposed open and closed lotus buds.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unmarked, found in drawer labelled 'mainly Naukratis.'
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0389) (Phase 1)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 684, no. 519, pl. 182, no. 519)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
